attributes.action: block above inflation rises in water bills.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
E.g. Wessex Water: 24% year on year rise in profits, 11% increase in water bills. Speculation: if this goes on a mass pay strike is inevitable.
Profits do not seem economically "normal", are they derived from under-investment?
Where environmental concerns necessitate genuine increases these should be paid out of general taxation: massive increases in water bills are a tax on a basic commodity that bears most heavily on the poorest.
No public ownership (e.g. Wessex Water used to be owned by ENRON, now owned by a Malaysian company) and no free market: this whole situation is very WRONG.
